An overwhelmingly amazing storyline with graphics that are still stunning 6 years later. Highly recommended to those that love single player FPS with an immersive story.
one of the better games out there on the market
Good graphic, good gameplay, Impressive story, truly ahead of its time
Amazing game mind blowing story donâ€™t rule this game out because the gun play is sluggish and not that great, this makes you use everything at your disposal and thatâ€™s what makes it brilliant

It took me a long time to get used to the newer graphics look - the brightness, the open air, as well as the reaction of this-does-not-look-like-Bioshock. Not to mention it's 1912. I'm glad I stuck with it eventually, as Infinite has an interesting story to tell as well as 2 excellent main characters. Infinite attempts to expand your universe and while it may not always hit that goal, it's an admirable attempt.

I also recommend the DLC of Burial at Sea Parts 1 & 2 - Booker and Elizabeth meet again on Rapture, just before the events of Bioshock occur. Although actually Part 1 is short and dull as dishwater it's just like the oyster stew served by my parents on Christmas Eve ... you have to get through it to get to the opening of the presents (Part 2).

One of the best games I've ever played, period. It simplifies the mechanics significantly from previous titles, but the story line is what I was interested in, and it did not disappoint.
Six years on, still one of the best games I've ever played.  Story, Gameplay, design, it is all fantastic and worth one's time to play.

BIOSHOCK INFINITE: I liked it! Story was great, gameplay was fun and didn't feel too unfair when I died. 10/10.

BURIAL AT SEA EP 1: A bit short, but fun nonetheless. 8/10.

BURIAL AT SEA EP 2: You can't eat the baguette in the beginning. 0/10.
Very awesome and fun game, enjoyed it a lot.
beautiful gameplay and design with an amazing plot.
I'm a fan of dishonored and stealth games with super powers.. this got the superpower part covered well, still enjoyed the game and it's lovely having such wonderful companion in the game

Bioshock Infinite is a good game but a bad BIOSHOCK game. In the same way that the original Bioshock was a spiritual successor to System Shock 2, this game feels more like a spiritual successor to Bioshock 1. Yes, there are references to the original game (the lighthouse, Rapture, Vigors, etc.), but the gameplay is a largely different style. Bioshock Infinite adopts a more action oriented and linear gameplay style, as opposed to Bioshock's more open ended gameplay. Everyone loves this game's story, but I personally think it doesn't hold a candle to the other Bioshock games. The characters, aside from Elizabeth, aren't really as interesting, and simply put: Columbia isn't as interesting as Rapture. With that said, Booker, the protagonist, and Elizabeth's interactions and small talk are genuinely entertaining; I like them. I'm not gonna say much about the ending, because I don't wanna spoil it for those who are interested, but I don't think it's very good. Overall, this is a solid FPS and worth playing. However, if you genuinely enjoyed the first two Bioshocks' gameplay and atmosphere, you may be disappointed with this one. 

7/10.

Never really played the previous BioShock games, this is the first one I've bought.
Honestly a great game, you don't need to know to much about the previous BioShock games to understand this ones story.
It's a campaign story that will stay a classic, the mechanics are great and everything. 
I would only recommend this if it is on sale, I don't know what the full price is but I paid around $7 on sale and it was completely worth it.

I donâ€™t know if I can call this a GOOD game in the traditional sense, but it is definitely addicting and has a ton of content so well worth the price, especially if you are into interior design or decorating. Even if youâ€™re not, though it will likely still keep you entertained.

Masterpiece.

If you're into narrative driven games and emotion-filled character development, then much like the original, this game must be experienced. The design, mechanics, and pacing are top notch too. This many years later, and Infinite is still my favorite game. I can't believe the writing lived up to the original. Ken Levine is a legend!

Don't forget the Burial at Sea DLC! It also has an important place in the Bioshock storyline(s).
